alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 01 at 4:18PM AKST until January 03 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR INTERIOR BRISTOL BAY... * WHAT...East to southeast winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Interior Bristol Bay, including Iliamna, Koliganek, and New Stuyahok. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. Gusty winds may cause blowing and drifting of snow. Any blowing snow may significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and best potential for 75 mph wind gusts will be overnight Tuesday night. While not expected to reach warning levels, gusts as high as 60 mph are also possible along the Alaska Peninsula south of King Salmon, including Port Heiden, Pilot Point, and Egegik.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
